channel.title: PyBites - Challenge
channel.description: A Community that Masters Python through Code Challenges

item.title: Code Challenge 51 - Analyse NBA Data with SQL/sqlite3
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, Welcome to Pybites Code Challenge 51! In this challenge we get you analysing NBA player data from a CSV file.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 50 - Use Celery to Offload an Expensive Task
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, back-to-back with our Planet Python challenge 49 here is our special Easter Challenge #50 where you will use Celery to offload a simplified Easter ecard mailer app.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 49 - Contribute to Open Source: Clean up Planet Python
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, it has been silent on the Community Blog challenges front, but then again we completed the 100 Days of Code in Python course which was a great milestone. Although less frequent, we will keep doing blog challenges though, not to worry! Let's start with a long pending item: cleaning up Python planets feeds, an interesting and valuable open source contribution.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 48 - Create a Python News Digest Tool
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, welcome to a new year of challenges. Are you as amazed as we are by all the awesome Python stuff that comes out every week? But then you feel you always are behind because you lack the time to keep up? Welcome to daily reality. In this challenge we have you contribute to our community with tools to improve our weekly delivery of Python News. Be creative, have fun!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 47 - PyBites First Year in Data (Special)
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, can you believe it’s been a full year of PyBites already?! To commemorate our 1st birthday we figured the next challenge should be around… us!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 46 - Add Continuous Integration (CI) to Your Project
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, becoming a Python developer is partly about knowing your tools. Managing your environment, testing and continuous integration are unmissable skills when you start working on bigger projects with a team. So we decided to dedicate a code challenge to deployment. Take an existing projects or make a demo app from scratch, the goal is to build an automated pipeline. Will you be the next guy or girl at work receiving kudos for setting up a Jenkins server? Have fun!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 45 - TDD: Code FizzBuzz Writing Tests First!
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, it’s time to do things differently! Test-Driven Development has to be one of the hardest programming methodologies to adopt yet also one of the most satisfying. It forces a different mindset which is definitely not for everyone. Either way, put your thinking caps on and jump in!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 44 - Marvel Data Analysis (Alicante PyChallengeDay)
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, this is a very special edition! Today, the 10th of November, we launch our first Live Code Challenge. We partnered up with Python Alicante and we will be hosting this code challenge with them at the University of Alicante. If you don't happen to live in Alicante but do want to code today 10am-13pm CET you are more than welcome to join this Gitter channel.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 43 - Build a Chatbot Using Python
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, it's incredible to think how quickly bots have grown in popularity. They're everywhere these days and will play an important role how we work and communicate in the near future! It's about time we go our bot on as well!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 42 - Mastering Regular Expressions
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, it's beginning of the month so we're busy selecting some cool code challenges for you to work on to hone your Python skills. Regular Expressions was a long time coming so let's get it out there. We hope we hit a decent intermediate level with this challenge. If you have questions ask us in the comments or join our Slack.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 41 - Daily Python Tip Part 2 - Build an API
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, you heard of Daily Python Tip? It's a Twitter account that posts one python tip per day, run by @karlafej and @simecek. We partnered up with them and use their awesome collection of tips to build a web app (part 1) and a simple API (part 2).
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 40 - Daily Python Tip Part 1 - Make a Web App
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, you heard of Daily Python Tip? It's a Twitter account that posts one python tip per day, run by @karlafej and @simecek. We partnered up with them and use their awesome collection of tips to build a web app (part 1) and a simple API (part 2).
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 39 - Writing Tests With Pytest
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, let's add some more challenges for October. Following our Python testing with pytest book review we let you write some tests with this awesome framework.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 38 - Build Your Own Hacktoberfest Checker With Bottle
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, Hacktoberfest started. Let's make open source better and track our progress with a little app you will build using the Bottle web framework.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 37 - Automate a Task With Twilio
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, this week we got a really cool challenge for you. Our Never Forget A Friend’s Birthday with Python, Flask and Twilio article got released on Twilio's blog and we thought it would be awesome to have you code up the next Twilio app. Join our challenge and if you build something serious you could even pitch it to Twilio!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 36 - Create an AWS Lambda Function
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python coding! We are delighted to have Michael Herman (Real Python) back to deliver this week's challenge. Prepare to learn some useful new skills and above all have fun!
item.dc:creator: Michael Herman

item.title: Code Challenge 35 - Improve Your Python Code With BetterCodeHub
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python programming! Last week we wrote an article on improving the quality of your code with Better Code Hub. This week we let you refactor a Python project. You can even win awards thanks to SIG who is sponsoring this challenge!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 34 - Build a Simple API With Django REST Framework
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python programming! We love Django (#100DaysOfDjango) and Web APIs. Django REST framework combines the two. "Now is better than never." - let's jump right in and let's use this week's code challenge to build a simple API. In this article some ideas what we can build and links to resources to get started. Have fun and don't forget to share (PR) your work, we can learn a lot from each other. Enjoy!
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 33 - Build a Django Tracker, Weather or Review App
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python programming. To keep it #100DaysOfDjango, this week we let you get some more practice with this awesome web framework. Last time we had an open Django challenge, for this one we have you choose between 3 specific apps.
item.dc:creator: PyBites

item.title: Code Challenge 32 - Test a Simple Django App With Selenium
item.description: Hi Pythonistas, a new week, a new 'bite' of Python goodness. As anticipated this week we dedicate a challenge to Selenium testing. We think this is a cool skill to add to your web dev + testing repertoire.
item.dc:creator: PyBites
